A young boy has hilariously upstaged Pope Francis at the Vatican as he went on stage and rolled around the floor during the weekly general audience. item.title: Pope hails economic, moral value of work - Agenzia ANSA
item.description:
Pope hails economic, moral value of work  Agenzia ANSA

(ANSA) - Vatican City, November 28 - Pope Francis on Wednesday hailed the "economic and moral value" of work. Speaking at his weekly general audience in the Paul VI Hall, Francis also said "you cannot follow Jesus if you are weighed down by baggage". He also recalled a Polish family wiped out for having helped Jews in WWII. The pope also thanked some Franciscan monks from Syria saying he understood and shared their suffering. During the audience, a young boy climbed onto the pope's said, prompting Francis to quip, "he's undisciplined, he's Argentinian". Read the full article on ANS...

item.description:
Church assets can be sold to help poor if necessary - Pope  Agenzia ANSA

(ANSA) - Vatican City, November 29 - Pope Francis has mooted the idea of Catholic Church assets being sold in some cases to help the poor, while stressing that this is only one of several options. "The (Church's) cultural assets are directed towards the charitable activities carried out by the ecclesiastical community," the pope said in a message to participants at a conference on decommissioning places of worship and management of ecclesiastical cultural heritage at the Pontifical Gregorian University. item.title: Polish Church asks for forgiveness for pedophilia cases - Reuters
item.description:
Polish Church asks for forgiveness for pedophilia cases  Reuters

Poland's Catholic Church on Monday asked victims of sexual abuse by the clergy for forgiveness, a month after an appeal court upheld a ruling stating the Church was responsible for the crimes of one if its priests. The Catholic Church worldwide is reeling from crises involving sexual abuse of minors, damaging confidence in the Church in Chile, the United States, Australia and Ireland and other countries. item.title: Pope to meet with young inmates, AIDS patients in Panama - The Associated Press
item.description:
Pope to meet with young inmates, AIDS patients in Panama  The Associated Press

VATICAN CITY (AP) — The Vatican is confirming Pope Francis will travel to Panama in January for the Catholic Church's big youth rally, and says he'll also spend time there with juvenile delinquents and people suffering from AIDS. History's first Latin American pope will be making his first visit to Central America, though he has been to Mexico, Cuba and several countries in South America. item.description:
Sins born from evil desires says pope  Agenzia ANSA

item.title: Pope Taps Experts, US Cardinal to Help Prep for Abuse Summit - VOA News
item.description:
Pope Taps Experts, US Cardinal to Help Prep for Abuse Summit  VOA News

Pope Francis named the Vatican's top sex abuse investigator and a close U.S. ally to an organizing committee for a February abuse prevention summit whose stakes have grown after the Holy See blocked U.S. bishops from taking action to address the scandal. Abuse survivors and women working at the Vatican will also contribute to the preparatory committee. item.title: Mute boy storms stage at Pope Francis audience, steals the show by playing & annoying Swiss Guard - RT
item.description:
Mute boy storms stage at Pope Francis audience, steals the show by playing & annoying Swiss Guard  RT

When Pope Francis is in the room all eyes are usually focused on him – but that wasn’t the case Wednesday when one very excited little boy stole the limelight, breaking through crowds to play and roll around at the Pope’s feet. To the horror of his mother, the boy managed to get free of her clutches and ran onto the papa podium during a general audience with the Pope at the Vatican. The child ran on for a closer look – and began pulling on the sleeves of a Swiss guardsman and playing behind the pontiff’s chair. item.title: Pope calls for Christian statesmen - Agenzia ANSA
item.description:
Pope calls for Christian statesmen  Agenzia ANSA

(ANSA) - Rome, November 23 - Pope Francis on Friday said today's complex political times called for Christian politicians of caliber. "The complexity of Italian and international political life requires lay faithful and statesman of high human and Christian substance at the service of the common good," Francis said during an audience with members of the Giorgio La Pira foundation. The Argentine pontiff said that politicians should not "give into temptation" and seek personal profit rather than pursuing the interests of the whole community. item.title: Pope decries that 'wealthy few' feast on what belongs to all - The Associated Press
item.description:
Pope decries that 'wealthy few' feast on what belongs to all  The Associated Press

VATICAN CITY (AP) — Championing the cause of the poor, Pope Francis on Sunday lamented that "the wealthy few" enjoy what, "in justice, belongs to all" and said Christians cannot remain indifferent to the growing cries of the exploited and the indigent, including migrants. Francis invited about 6,000 poor people as well as some of the volunteers who help them to the splendor of St. Peter's Basilica where he celebrated Mass on a day the Catholic Church dedicates to the needy. item.description:
We are brothers pope tells Jews  Agenzia ANSA

(ANSA) - Vatican City, November 22 - Pope Francis on Thursday told Jews "we are bothers and must work together for peace".
